Posts.Content: Oct 6, 2012 12:26PM Tammy2012 wrote: I was diagnosed in Feb 2012 and have been battling Tricare ever since!!   I called to verify codes myself and was told they were all covered benefits with NAR.  Myriad called to tell me Tricare was no longer covering this test and i needed to sign a form stating if my claim was denied that i would be liable for it.  NOT!!   I called Tricare only to find out that yes, they are covered benefits with NAR but they will not pay anything to Myriad and i needed to go to another lab.  I explained to them that Myriad is the only lab that does the testing Since then, Myriad has changed their codes to one all inclusive code.  That code is on the Government No Pay list, which means it cannot be appealed.  I'm retired military and Tricare has the nerve to tell me "Thank you for your service" at the end of our conversations.  Pfffft!! I did receive a call from Myriad telling me that they were in negotiations with Tricare and was expecting the test to start being covered sometime in October.  October 1 is the beginning of our fiscal year.  I called Tricare on Oct 2 and it's still not being covered. I call them every 2 weeks and tell them i'm documenting our conversations and i advise them to do the same.   I'm triple negative and was relying on those test results to decide if i would have a lumpectomy or a mastectomy.  I went with the lumpectomy and started radation on thursday. Here is the new code: 81211 Myriad told me this code covered everything.  BRCA 1 & 2 Comprehensive Testing.  Myriad was also kind enough to offer me a 10% cash discount.  I just needed to pay them $3006 up front and they would be more than happy to do the testing for me.  I tell ya...i just want to send them a big fat Thank you card!!
Posts.Title: Military Spouces Help with BRCA Test Code for Tricare Lori-ann Tammy2012
